articles.title: Today at the World Cup - another milestone, another goal for Messi
articles.description: Lionel Messi scored on his 1,000th senior appearance as Argentina beat Australia 2-1 to seal their place in the World Cup quarter-finals.
articles.content:
Lionel Messi, second right, is mobbed by his team-mates after scoring Argentina’s opening goal against Australia (Martin Rickett/PA)

articles.title: Thousands of fans pack into Federation Square to watch the Socceroos take on Argentina
articles.description: Police made two arrests and used OC spray on some people, but say crowd behaviour was generally good as 15,000 people pack into Federation Square to watch the Socceroos play Argentina.
articles.content:
Police made two arrests but say fan behaviour was generally good as Socceroos supporters gathered in Melbourne to watch Australia's World Cup match against Argentina this morning.
Key points: Victoria Police said 15,000 fans gathered at federation Sq... [2219 chars]

articles.title: World Cup 2022: Socceroos midfielder Jackson Irvine says Argentina’s celebrations show Australia’s quality
articles.description: An emotional Jackson Irvine hopes the Socceroos have done Australia proud and believes Argentina’s extravagant celebrations show his team are ready to take the next step — if they haven’t already.
articles.content:
An emotional Jackson Irvine hopes the Socceroos have done Australia proud and believes Argentina’s extravagant celebrations show his team are ready to take the next step — if they haven’t already.

articles.title: Argentines take to the streets to celebrate World Cup win over Australia
articles.description: Jubilant fans celebrated across Argentina after the country defeated Australia on Saturday and advanced to the quarterfinals of the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES, Dec 2 (Reuters) - Jubilant fans celebrated across Argentina after the country defeated Australia on Saturday and advanced to the quarterfinals of the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.
After the 2-1 victory against the Australians, thousands of A... [1306 chars]

articles.title: Messi stars as Argentina set up World Cup quarter-final date with Netherlands
articles.description: Lionel Messi finally scored a goal in the knockout rounds of the World Cup on Saturday as he inspired Argentina to a 2-1 win over Australia that sets up a mouthwatering quarter-final showdown with the Netherlands, who proved too strong for the United States earlier.

articles.title: World Cup 2022: Lionel Messi keeps Argentina dreams alive after scoring in 1,000th game
articles.description: On his 1,000th appearance in professional football, Lionel Messi stepped up again to keep Argentina's World Cup dream alive.
articles.content:

articles.title: Ken Early: Argentina’s Alvarez and Messi combine to unleash modernity and magic on World Cup
articles.description: Australia put to the sword by the genius Messi in his 1,000th game
articles.content:
The joy on his face said it all. At last, at long last – in his fifth tournament, in his 23rd appearance, on the night of his 1,000th career game – Lionel Messi felt like he had really, truly turned up at the World Cup.
Messi had done some great thin... [6183 chars]

articles.title: World Cup: Lionel Messi marks 1,000th game with a goal as Argentina beat Australia in last-16
articles.description: The footballing legend broke the deadlock towards the end of the first-half with a sweet finish after combining smartly with former Manchester City star Nicolas Otamendi on the edge of the penalty area.
articles.content:
Lionel Messi marked his 1,000th senior game with a goal to help see Argentina through to the World Cup quarter-finals by beating Australia.
